data.title: Default themes need to handle jsx evaluated code scopes for better coloring
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
- OS Version:

Used latest vscode extension from https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-vscode.typescript-javascript-grammar

From @emzero at Microsoft/TypeScript-tmLanguage#280 
Version 1.5.3
Commit 5be4091987a98e3870d89d630eb87be6d9bafd27
Date 2016-09-22T08:50:42.185Z
Shell 0.37.6
Renderer 49.0.2623.75
Node 5.10.0
Windows 7 SP1 x64

Using the [Latest TypeScript and Javascript Grammar Extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-vscode.typescript-javascript-grammar) does provide better Typescript syntax coloring but code between `{ }` in Typescript React is being colored as plain text.

Here's a screenshot using the default dark+ theme.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/412489/18976838/a231a5b4-868b-11e6-9696-92f980332ef1.png)

Note that the grammar does scope the code in tsx file between `{` and `}` and Microsoft/TypeScript-tmLanguage@67954e4  gets into master (probably today) its going to be even more readable and is going to be scoped as `meta.embedded.expression` so theme needs to handle these better. (Note before this change it was scoped as `meta.brace.curly`` which seems incorrect and hence the change. 

https://github.com/babel/babel-sublime uses same scope name `meta.embedded.expression`  for jsx evaluated code.

data.title: [themes] improvements expressions in template string
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
- OS Version:

Used latest vscode extension from https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-vscode.typescript-javascript-grammar

This can also be found when using extension https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-vscode.js-atom-grammar

From @mhegazy at Microsoft/TypeScript-tmLanguage#287 
see `number` below
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8000722/19012536/bdb0de44-876d-11e6-9681-25e96f9b00ae.png)

The expression is tokenized as `meta.template.expression` but theme doesn't use this information to colorize it correctly. Also note that `number` in the expression is scoped as `variable.other.readwrite`. 

Probably `${` and `}` could be colored blue by using their scopes `punctuation.definition.template-expression.begin` and `punctuation.definition.template-expression.end`

data.title: [scss] !global flag marked as 'unknown keyword'
Force close all vscode instances to install update (reopening on previous state ofc)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: all
- OS Version: windows

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Get some users working in their sessions with VSCode launched on you machine
2. Try to install Update - Access Denied error

What to do:
1. Ask before install - do you want to force close all instances?
2. If Yes - close'em and install
3. Reopen them when installation finished - ideal situation - other users will not notice something changed, just VSCode blinking

data.title: Switching to a "comparison" tab always puts the cursor back to the start of the file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 Enterprise

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Right click on a working file and choose "Select to compare" 
2. Right click on another working file and choose "Compare with...". This will open a tab showing the comparison.
3. Scroll down to a position.
4. Open another file / switch to another tab.
5. Go back to the comparison tab - the cursor is back at the start of the document and the scroll position is lost.

data.title: VSCode not start the Windows command prompt.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3 e 1.6.0-insiders 602155b
- OS Version: Windows 10

--Sorry for the English, I used Google Translator --

Steps to Reproduce:

1.See the gif, when I type `start code.exe`, show me an error. But when I put a space between `code` and `.exe`, the plumb starts with an open tab ".exe".

![gif](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19866231/19043959/a322a27c-8968-11e6-814f-f345efd36eda.gif)

2.The same goes for insiders version.

![gif - 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19866231/19043975/b87084be-8968-11e6-9c7c-20584925dc1b.gif)

And it should open with the last opened folder, as currently happens when we click the shortcut, and not an empty file. If there is a setting to always open with empty workspace, should be to keep the setting.

data.title: Add Explorer right-click options to the file tab right-click options
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Right-click the tabs for a file.
2. Compare with right-clicking the file in the Explorer.

Feature Request: Add all/more of the Explorer right-click options to the tabs for a file. My main request is Copy Path.

data.title: fix typo in type definition
Problems under a file should be sorted by Problem type and then by line number
data.body: Currently problems under a file are sorted by line, but it makes more sense to show all errors first followed by warnings and others and all groups sorted by line number

data.title: Trim trailing whitespace only on changed lines

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Feature Request:

When working with existing old code base it's not ideal to have the whole file trimmed for trailing whitespace. However, it's still a nice feature to have active for changed lines. That way the codebase will be cleaned up as you work on it.

data.title: VS Code is difficult to use on a virtual file system over a network (gvfs)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hi, 
I use the latest version on ubuntu and I work through gvfs.
I like the editor and I am trying to totally move from sublime, but I still have two big problems 
1)  when I switch tab the editor tries everytime to update the content from the network not using the cache, it is nuisance on slow networks.
2) after I save a tab content, randomly, the tab gets closed.
These two things together, turn my working in a hell.
Is there a solution, I bet those are not  bugs but just a setting to change...
thanks

data.title: [Help wanted] Is there a keybinding for moving a specific number of lines up/down?
data.body: PgUp is very extreme and moving one line up is slow, it would really help if I there was a keybinding that allowed me to move up/down 3-4 lines at a time. Can I redfine PgUp or maybe there's an unbounded command for something like that?

data.title: Command line option -g FILE:LINE not working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.2 (66f37fd2a99eb9d628dd374d81d78835b410c39b, 2016-09-12T13:30:03.456Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601

Steps to Reproduce:

1.open command prompt.
2. ensure in local directory, say c:\somedirectory. Ensure c:\somedirectory contains somefile.ext
2. `code -g somefile.ext:2`      :- This works
3. `code -g c:\somedirediretory\somefile.ext:2`     :- does not work, gives error "Arguments in '--goto' mode should be in the format of 'FILE(:LINE(:COLMUMN))'.
4 `code -g "c:\somedirediretory\somefile.ext:2"`  :- does not work. gives same error as above.

data.title: Failed to save 'httpd.conf': A system error occured (EACCES: permission denied, open
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3 (1.5.3)
- OS Version: EL Capitan

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In a terminal window type: open /etc/apache/httpd.conf (or a file owned by root)
2. make changes to the file and cmd+s to save.
3. Error appears on the title bar: Failed to save 'httpd.conf': A system error occured (EACCES: permission denied, open '/private/etc/apache2/httpd.conf')

I expect VS Code to ask for my password for authorization. Because if I do the same things with Atom, it opens an OSX native window asking for password. Can we have the same window asking for password instead of giving error?
Also, I noticed that this path _/private/etc/apache2_ (in the error bar) is different than what I typed.

data.title: Problems view should maintain scroll position
data.body:
- VSCode Version: insiders
- OS Version: os x

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Have lots of problems, open problems view and scroll down
2. Hide / show problems view
3. Notice that the problems view is now scrolled all the way to the top - we should maintain the scroll position as we do for all the other panels https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12937

data.title: [i18n] Fix ru locale
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Win 10

On i18n\rus\src\vs\workbench\parts\git\browser\gitQuickOpen.i18n.json 

```
"checkoutRemoteBranch": "   {0}"
```

It should be

```
"checkoutRemoteBranch": "   {0}"
```

 means "delete", that is incorrect
 means remote

data.title: Incorrect syntax highlighting for Markdown?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS: elementary OS 0.3.2 Freya (built on Ubuntu 14.04)
- Please refer to lines 18 - 21 in the screenshot for details.

![](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10341686/19030630/943352a2-8981-11e6-94e2-02e0e9b35919.png)

``````
# Arbitrary Piece of code

```c
#include <stdio.h>

int main(void)
{
    puts("hello world");
    return 0;
}
```

## The 2nd Heading

Lorem ipsum minim amet laboris id aliquip quis duis qui aliquip tempor ut.
Above is the main function (`int main(void)`).

## This Heading is not rendered properly

Also note that things'll get even worse after an apostrophe.
Excepteur nulla occaecat pariatur excepteur.
Reprehenderit laboris do laboris eu esse labore sit consequat.
In culpa ut mollit quis eu excepteur veniam.
``````

Any ideas?

data.title: Show message when detected encoding of file is non UTF
data.body:
This related to #5388, #10013.

![screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3643499/19026740/5f60efc0-8964-11e6-9626-de4744bae0ef.gif)
1. Always open file with user preference.
2. If detected non utf encoding, show guess encoding via jschardet.
3. When press 'Reopen', reopen with guess encoding.

data.title: Buggy tabCompletion
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: OS X

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set `"editor.tabCompletion": false` in `settings.json`
2. Try to type `d-b` in css and press `Tab` for Emmet abbreviation expansion, you'll get something like `-ms-word-break:` instead of `display: block` (surprise!).
3. You will actually get an autocomplete suggestion from the first item of the suggestions box (unexpected).

Expected:
- when `"editor.tabCompletion" = false` tab shouldn't expand the suggestions
- when `"editor.tabCompletion" = true` tab should expand using the first suggestion

It's said `"editor.tabCompletion"` works better when `"editor.quickSuggestions"` is `false`. But if I switch it off, I get no suggestions at all. I need them and I actually use them often when abbreviations aren't suitable.

This is actually a horrible behavior, since it makes me chill when I try to use Emmet inside the VSCode.

Video: http://take.ms/KgTwR

- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-38-generic, Ubuntu 16.04
- Extensions: EditorConfig.EditorConfig-0.3.3, Tyriar.lorem-ipsum-1.0.0, Tyriar.sort-lines-1.1.0, Tyriar.theme-glacier-0.0.10, Tyriar.vscode-terminal-here-0.0.5, christian-kohler.path-intellisense-1.0.2, cssho.vscode-svgviewer-1.2.0, dbaeumer.vscode-eslint-1.0.7, eg2.tslint-0.5.39, felipecaputo.git-project-manager-0.1.15, ms-vscode.csharp-1.4.1, ms-vscode.typescript-javascript-grammar-0.0.2, rebornix.Ruby-0.8.0, rebornix.nova-0.0.5, redhat.java-0.0.4, ryu1kn.annotator-0.10.0, ryzngard.vscode-header-source-1.0.4

Steps to Reproduce:

3. The instance of VS Code I was working on remained fine

This has only happened once.

data.title: Excessive startup time (near-hang), then OK

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Win7 Ultimate 32-bit, all Windows updates installed (VMware Fusion 8.5 on OS X 10.11)
- Pristine VSCode installation (no extensions installed, default settings)

Symptoms:
- On launching, only 2 processes show up: `Code.exe` without parameters, and the GPU process (running with `--disable-gpu` to eliminate the latter makes no difference):

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/588825/19022775/ce9b2a70-88ad-11e6-9ca0-4c25753b7e2b.png)

No window shows up, and the `Code.exe`-without-params process is near 100% for ca. 2.5  minutes, with very little memory activity and virtually no IO (the GPU process shows virtually no CPU or GPU activity); the I/O spike and memory increase at the end is when the window finally opens:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/588825/19022777/d326a2e0-88ad-11e6-8db7-6fd60c4f6e69.png)

Once the window is visible, additional `Code.exe` processes appear, CPU activity subsides, and things appear to work normally.

data.title: Support launching VS Code from Bash on Ubuntu on Windows
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Unpacked and installed "code_1.5.3-1474533365_amd64.deb"
- OS Version: Windows 10 with WSL, latest patched.

Steps to Reproduce:
(NOTE: I am running Xming on my Windows 10 host, and have "export DISPLAY=:0" set in my .bashrc file)
1. Open Bash on Ubuntu on Windows
2. Type "code" and press ENTER.

Expected result:
Code launches in a GUI window.

Actual result:
Absolutely nothing happens. There is no output. The prompt just returns in a couple of seconds.
